articles.title: Can the president really kill off the penny? Should he?
articles.author: Jay L. Zagorsky
articles.summary: The U.S. Mint has made about 5 billion pennies annually throughout the 2020s, down from about 11 billion each year in the 1990s. So far in 2025, it has only made about a quarter of a million pennies. Last year, the mint lost $85 million making pennies and $18 million minting nickels. The Constitution authorizes Congress to change the type of coins the mint produces. Congress has tried to eliminate the penny in the past but failed.
